data.sampled: The name of the option strategy being implemented here is an iron condor spread. This is a non-directional options trading strategy that involves selling a wider range of options than it buys, thereby creating a net credit on the trade. In this case, there is a sale of a put and a call with higher strike prices and purchases of puts and calls with lower strike prices.

data.sampled: The name of the option strategy being implemented in this scenario is a "bull spread". This is because the buyer of the options is taking a bullish position by purchasing an out-of-the-money (OTM) call and selling an OTM put, which means they expect the stock to go up slightly above or below their target prices ($40 and $53).
